prompt: How can I add a live translation service for official meetings?

citation_mappings.claim_text: You can add “live translation” to official meetings in two main ways. Pick based on how formal/accurate you need it to be. 1) Decide what “live translation” means for you Translated captions (AI text on screen): fast, cheaper, OK for internal meetings, not perfect for legal nuance. Simultaneous interpretation (human audio channels): best for official proceedings, hearings, negotiations. Hybrid (human interpreters + AI captions): common: interpreters for the floor + AI captions for accessibility. 2) If you use Zoom / Teams / Webex, start with built-ins Zoom: enable Translated Captions (real-time caption translation). Zoom
Microsoft Teams: use live translated captions / multilingual meeting features (licensing may be required, often Teams Premium or Microsoft 365 Copilot). Microsoft Support+1
Webex: host can enable real-time translation and transcription for meetings/webinars. Webex Help Center

This is the quickest path if captions-only is acceptable. 3) If you need “official-grade” interpretation, add a language-access platform Use a platform that can run professional interpreters, handle virtual/hybrid/in-room, and provide multiple language audio channels, plus optional captions (e.g., KUDO). KUDO
